column4: Is it possible to use a Hauppauge Win-TV NOVA-T USB stick on Ubuntu 12.04 at all? I can't get mine to work...
create a channel.conf using w_scan here's the command: w_scan -ft -c GB -X -R N -O N >> channels.conf
change the -c flag to your country code ie if in the states US
I'm in Norway. So I guess it should read NO?
Not sure what to do afterwards though....
it'll take a while to create channels.conf but when it's finished copy the channels.conf into the mplayer dir: cp channels.conf ~/.mplayer/channels.con
it'll take a while to create channels.conf but when it's finished copy the channels.conf into the mplayer dir: cp channels.conf ~/.mplayer/ then : mplayer dvb://
I might be out of luck. I don't think we have a signal for the kind of reciever where I am right now.... :(
ERROR: Sorry - i couldn't get any working frequency/transponder
Think I've done that already. No luck with that one either. I will bring the stick with me to a place where I KNOW there is coverage and try what you mentioned there....
